values:
OK, I couldn't even keep up with a Project 52 last year. :( Still, I haven't been swallowed by the ground or anything. Life's just been busy.

Last year was absolutely crazy at work. Finally, if I got some free moment, I found it hard to come up with anything to do... Before that, I would simply have gone and checked the latest lolcats, or hung around on some message boards.

A nicer thing that kept me busy were Bollywood dance classes, and rehearsing a number for a couple of school shows. I managed, and had a really great time. Experiencing the backstage chaos is just priceless!

I'll have to try and check this site every now and then again.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/100692.html
This is an artificial waterfall at a park from our last trip. Looks nice in any case.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/100442.html

While I was home between trips, I finally got at the garden. This patch looks a bit tidier now. Alas, the flowers are already past their best time of blossoming. Not that there still weren't a lot to do...
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/100182.html
OK, I know I'm awfully behind with my updates. Blame it on being on vacation, and the fact that it indeed does come in pints. :P
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/99886.html

A couple of days ago, I visited a handicrafts museum; a block of houses some 200 years old that had been kept like they were, featuring craftsmen's workshops and homes from the past centuries. One was a tobacco shop where tobacco products were also manufactured - and, the raw material was grown in the yard. I wonder if it was Old Toby or Longbottom Leaf?
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/99740.html

There aren't too many attractions in the town where our family spent the last weekend. One of them is this fast food restaurant, though, and not only because one can still get decent burgers there. It was founded by a real Elvis fan, and even the outside of the building tells to whom the place is dedicated. ;) Inside, there's all kinds of Elvis related stuff, and the walls of the toilets are papered with pictures of the King. They even used to have a jukebox with only Elvis records, but that one has probably been worn out because it wasn't there any longer. Now, if they just added the famous bacon-banana-peanut butter sandwiches on their menu...
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/99341.html

On Friday, I made a quick visit to Tampere, a city about 200 km north of Helsinki. Getting a hotel room was the only way to provide a place to stay overnight there for the older daughter who attended a Morrissey concert there; she had tried to get a room from a hostel, but they were all full. And, I didn't want to take the risk that she'd miss the last train homeward in the evening, and would have to find a place to stay until the first train in the morning would leave. Well, the trip provided a peaceful evening for me; I went to have a leisurely dinner, walked a bit in the city, and went back to our room to shower and pass the time reading. It was a bit of a nostalgia trip as well. First, the hotel where we stayed was the same where my husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary. Since then, it had been renovated, but kept very much to the old style. Second, right across the street from the hotel, there was a park where I played as a child when I was visiting my grandmother who lived on the other side of the park. Then, the playground wasn't as big and fine as it is now, but I never had problems passing my time there! Here's part of the playground as it is today; Grandma lived in the yellowish stone house on the right.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/99161.html

This weekend, we celebrated Midsummer. Originally, it was a Summer Solstice festival, and this year, it really took place close to the solstice (which was today). Bonfires are an ancient Midsummer tradition, and we went to see one with a couple of our friends.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/99068.html
I didn't come up with anything else, so here's a geranium from our back yard. I don't know if it's originally wild or planted; those flowers do grow wild here.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/98318.html
I was about to post this one yesterday, but got so caught up with other things that I forgot. Oh well. There's buds in the lilacs. They didn't quite get to bloom in time for the glorious May 25. :P
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/97993.html

I had planned to do some weeding today, but after a 15 kilometres walk, the thought somehow felt less attractive. :P So, I postponed it until tomorrow, and just took a couple of pics of the flowers that bloom at the moment.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/97696.html

We visited my parents today, to celebrate both Mother's Day and my father's 80th birthday which was yesterday. But, both in the morning before we went there, and in the evening after we returned, I finally got into gardening. My main task were some overgrown bushes; some needed just a bit of pruning, some had to be cut down, and some that had spread all too wide had to be uprooted. The last operation must have pissed off quite a few earthworms whose evening meal got disturbed. :D Here's just a small part of today's work:
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/97507.html

The 1st of May is some kind of a carnival here. People arrange parties and picnics, dress up funny, and drink a lot (too much in many cases). The different political parties also arrange their own events, and there are some other traditions as well, like the May Day concerts. For several years now, we've attended the Helsinki Philharmonics May Day concert of lighthearted classics. And on Saturday, there was another "must" concert that took me away from home for the night. The Tampere Philharmonics performed Howard Shore's Lord of the Rings Symphony, and since that was 200 kilometres away from home, the hubby and daughter and I stayed overnight at a very good hotel. The concert was great, and the weather was very favourable - this weekend has been like summer. So, it was an enjoyable trip by all means. Here's some of the May Day picnic mood on our way to the May Day concert.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/97024.html

The high season for indoor air samples is over, and it shows at my work; now, we're approximately back to normal. We spent yesterday afternoon at a cat show. At one time, the hubby and I used to visit them a lot, and I've taken the older kid to a couple ones, to see some beautiful kitties, but now, it had been years since the last time. There were some breeds that were new to us! But, the cats were just as lovely as before - and, there was a Norwegian Forest Cat that looked almost exactly like our first cat! And today, we attended a walking event so, I've been outdoors a lot. The weather has been great lately, and it shows in our yard.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/96972.html
The snowdrops started to push up as soon as the snow was gone, which on the shady front yard took a bit longer than on more sunny sites. They'll open any day now.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/96644.html

It has become some kind of a tradition for us to visit the annual vintage car show on the Easter holidays. Can't help it, but the cars they made about 50 years ago were beautiful, however unwieldy they were in every other respect... Here are some examples:
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/96321.html

The weather changed while I was in Ireland. Now, the temperatures are clearly above zero C, even on most nights, and the snow is quickly disappearing. It's great to wear a thinner coat and lighter shoes again! I had a great time on my trip, but as I've posted an account on the moot on TORC, I won't repeat it all here.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/96239.html
I'll post the photo for this week already today, because I'm leaving for Ireland early tomorrow morning. And, here's my suitcase, packed and ready.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/95941.html

Last week went in such a whirl that I even forgot to post a photo yesterday, and I'm still swamped. And now, I should start packing for my trip to Ireland on Thursday... The Christmas/Easter/whatever cactus started to bloom, anyway.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/95702.html

In the sixties, before Levi's and other world brands conquered the market, James was THE domestic brand for blue jeans. I remember wearing those as a kid, too. At some point, the brand was laid to rest, but it was revived a few years ago. For a few times now, there has been a retro-style dance in the country not too far from us; and, the organizers got the idea of calling them the James Dance, from the jeans brand. The music and style is like in the early '60s, and a lot of people also dress in the style of that era. Most of the audience comes there for the music and dance, and the place can practically only be reached by car, so there are very few drunks, although they sell beer at the bar. The hubby and I, together with a couple of friends, attended that dance yesterday evening for the second time. What a great opportunity to dress up and dance! They had these bills up on the walls; I don't know if they're new in retro style, or copies of some original bill from the sixties. (Again, I only had my cell phone camera available.) This weekend, I also took a short course in Irish dance, which is very much footwork, so my legs sure hurt from all that dancing...
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/95255.html

Nothing much to say this week. Got some things organized at work, and did some redecorating at home - found new lampshades for the bedside lamps and a new bed spread for daughter #2. And, enjoyed a long walk today. I took a photo of some dry stems of last year's flowers sticking up from the snow, of which we still have quite enough, although it's melting in the sun whenever the day is clear. It's taken on my cell phone so the quality isn't the best.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/95195.html

Last week made me all dizzy by Friday again. But now, I've managed to catch up with almost everything important. Yesterday and today, I've been on a weekend course on Afro-Disco, a dance style that's very efficient exercise! And, I can feel it in my body (ouch!). But, it was fun. This afternoon, I took the older daughter to her boyfriend. On the way back I stopped, and took a photo of the sunny snow-covered field on the other side of the railroad track.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/94941.html

Last week was murder. Our laboratory practices were auditioned on one day, and that meant having to share that day's work between the previous and the next day. And, on another day, there was a meeting that was mostly waste of time. Very nice on the busiest time of the year. Hope I can catch up with everything next week. On the other hand, I got myself a new pillow that my neck is very happy about. The photo of this week features the reading corner in our study, a place where I wish I could spend more time.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/94496.html

Last week was crazy at work. I was out of office for a day and a half, and because there's nobody else who can do my job, everything of course piled up. I didn't quite catch up with everything, some things got left until Monday; hope I can get back to schedule before the next craziness. On Saturday, then, I did just nothing. I've spent today packing; my younger one is going for a camp for the next week. And, the older one left for an overnight cruise with her friends today. Hope she'll behave. This week's picture features tracks of some critters that have visited our yard; some birds and at least one red squirrel have been around.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/94304.html

This weekend, I hit the road again. On Friday evening, there was a concert of songs by Joni Mitchell, especially her more jazzy stuff, arranged for a full symphony orchestra, and performed by two talented female jazz singers, again a couple of hours' drive from home. So, the hubby and I decided to make it another weekend of pampering ourselves a bit, and reserved a room for two nights at a good hotel at a walking distance from the concert venue to ourselves and daughter #2. (#1 sure enjoyed a weekend with her boyfriend without any parents around! :D ) The concert was good, and after it, it was nice to enjoy a couple glasses of wine and crawl to bed instead of having to drive back home, especially when the weather wasn't the best. So, we had the whole Saturday just for relaxing. The hubby took the daughter for a long walk, and I went to see an exhibition that interested me at one of the local museums. Earlier this year, I had purchased some things from Lush at more than 50 euros, and had got my choice of their gift packages thrown in. I chose the Serenity package, because it contained most shower stuff; but, there were some bath items as well - a bath bomb, a bubble bath slice, and a bath melt. And, we don't have a tub at home. But, I remembered that at least some rooms at the hotel where we were staying had a bathtub; so, I asked the hubby to get us a room with a tub if possible, and he did. So, I packed some Lush with me; and, in the evening, my daughter enjoyed a bubble bath, and I used the bath melt. Luxury! At the museum, there's a permanent exhibition in addition to the changing ones. An important part of the permanent collection was gifted by a diplomat family that collected antiques while serving abroad during the first half of the 20th century. The lady of the house was fond of Madonna statues; the pictures of this week feature some items from her collection (sorry for the quality, the photos were again taken with my cell phone, and I couldn't use flash).
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/93968.html

Boy, I'm tired. I've had a great weekend, but got all too little sleep. Yesterday, we went to an annual twang music (the Shadows - the Ventures style) festival in a town a couple of hours' drive away. The event is at a hotel where we of course were also staying, and as we still can't take the younger daughter to the concert with us - there's an age limit of 18 because it's at their club premises where they sell alcohol - the older one came along to watch over her while the hubby and I were away. The bands were mostly good, some of our friends were there as well, we had fun, but I've only slept for a few hours last night. So, guess who is going to hit the sack early this evening? This week's photos are of frost flowers on the window of our hotel room; yesterday was quite cold, and there had been moisture between the window panes. The quality may not be the best because they were taken on a cell phone camera.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/93848.html

I'm posting this in a much brighter study than before. :) When we moved into this house some ten years ago, we put our old living-room lamp into the study, and for a time, it was good. But, the lamp was already old at that point, and it wasn't of the best quality in the first place. During the years, the shade turned from white to brown and didn't let the light properly through anymore, so the room was quite dim even with the lights on. Recently, we got enough of the situation, and yesterday, we went and bought a new lamp. Now, it's up in the ceiling, and the lighting conditions of this room have vastly improved! We saved the old lamp for now, except the shade that broke when I took it off - it could still possibly be used somewhere, if a new shade could be found (which is uncertain with a lamp that's almost 20 years old). The picture of this week features, well, snow. It snowed for a couple of days; at first, the snow was rather wet, and slid down the porch roof. At some point it froze, though, and the sheet of snow didn't break, but remained hanging from the edge of the roof like some kind of a curtain:
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/93546.html
The photo of this week features an orchid that my daughter got from her boyfriend. Who says young men can't get romantic?
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/93195.html

... here's another meme for you. 1. What are your online user names? Rowanberry, rowaninbloom, Morwinyoniel, Erinti, Fairy Hedgehog 2. How does your hair look currently? Medium brown with a few greys, straight, down my neck, and badly in need of a trim. 3. What's new in your life right now? Getting bifocals. 4. How many colors are you wearing now? Three. Four if the stripes on my socks count. 5. Are you an introvert or extrovert? Introvert, hands down. 6. What was the last book you read? The last one I finished was Jingo by Terry Pratchett. I'm almost through Morgoth's Ring. 7. Do you nap a lot? No 8. Which real or fictional location is your dream vacation destination? Real: Australia and New Zealand. Fictional: the southern fiefs of Gondor. 9. Is there anything that has made you happy these days? It isn't all dark any longer when I go home from work! 10. What's your current obsession? Don't have one. 11. How long does it take you to get ready in the morning? An hour if I have to wake up the offspring, 45 minutes if I don't. 12. What websites do you visit daily? TORC, CoE, TOB. 13. Do you write fic? What was the last fic you wrote? I have written fic, but that was ages ago. The last one was sort of a crossing between Star Trek and The Bold and Beautiful, and should be utterly forgotten... 14. What's the last thing you laughed about? The lolcat pics that I looked at this morning. 15. What's the last song that got stuck in your head? King of the Surf by The Trashmen. 16. What's the last movie you saw? The LOTR trilogy - I count them as one. 17. Would you enter a relationship with your ideal partner, even if you knew he/she was seriously involved with/married to someone else and would never leave them? No, I wouldn't. It's either me or the other one. 18. What is your least favourite thing to do that you did today? Getting up in the morning. And, as practically everybody I know was already tagged, I'll tag anybody who happens to read this.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/93087.html

So, on Wednesday, my two weeks of freedom were over, and work called. Fortunately, there wasn't such a pile waiting for me as I feared, but still enough to keep me busy for the rest of the week. At home, we got a small improvement made. Our old kitchen chairs had started to fall apart, and we had been talking for quite a time that we should go and get new ones. So, on Monday, when the hubby and I were both on holiday, we headed for the furniture shops. And, we ended up buying not only new chairs, but a new table as well - the old one had been acquired to a very different kitchen, and although it was still good otherwise, it didn't quite fit into our current one. The new furniture arrived on Thursday. And, in addition to work, there has been some fun as well. Yesterday evening, the hubby and I attended a surf and twang music concert at a club near his workplace. We had a nice evening, and were home around 3 am... The photo of this week features my "pets": Dracella and Mr Fusspot. Dracella flew to me all the way from Australia for Christmas; she was a gift from Donna, my TOB Secret Santa. As soon as I saw the dragon it looked like a female to me, and it took a while before I could come up with a name for her. But, it actually took even longer to name Mr Fusspot. I got him last spring, and although I had read Making Money by then, the idea only came to me recently: he's small and ugly - just like Mr Fusspot. And, that was it. :D
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/92743.html

So, we've moved on to 2009. We didn't have any wild party, but after being up until something like 2 am and not quite sober, I took New Year's Day easy. Slept late, and only dragged myself from the bed to watch the traditional New Year's Concert from Vienna. In my childhood and youth, it was a family tradition, and it has mostly continued through my adulthood. On some years, I actually didn't watch the broadcast, just had it on in the background while doing something else (or nothing). In the past, I learned to recognise some of the musicians by looks, and could see how they changed over the years ("hey, there's that guy - my, he has gone grey!") until they finally retired, and were replaced by younger musicians. And, the various conductors, some of whom had really great expressions... :D Yesterday, after recovering, our family jumped into the car and drove to another city about 1.5 hours away, to see an interesting exhibition at the local art museum. It was about art, design, fashion, and music in the 1960s and 1970s - that is, the childhood and youth of the hubby and I. The art was actually rather good, as was the design (except those horrible trend colours of the '70s), the music mostly splendid (even the disco sounds good nowadays). But, the fashion, especially in the seventies! My, what horrors we wore in our teens! As I said in my previous entry, I won't post a photo for every day this year, but rather, a Photo of the Week. This week, we've had great weather, sunny and cold, although there's still no snow. So, the picture of this week is of frosty branches in the midwinter sun.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/92528.html

The Project 365+1 of 2008 is over, and this time, I made it to the end. Next year, I won't take up anything like this - but, maybe I'll do a "Photo of the Week" or something like that, to not completely forget my LJ. On Monday, I visited my parents. This is the view from their balcony; I used to play and let the dogs run free on those cliffs. And even now, there was someone walking their dog - they appeared soon after I had taken the picture. And so, we went toward the end of the year. The weather has been favourable today; so, there's the last sunset of this year. Happy New Year, everybody! I've still got some 4.5 hours to go.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/92392.html
But, at least we've had some sunshine. :)
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/92110.html

We got a little bit of snow, and frosty weather, so that the world isn't totally dark. And, with this picture that doesn't follow the theme, I'd like to wish all my friends Merry Christmas / Happy Hanukah / Joyful Yule / a great whatever holiday you're celebrating. :)
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/91777.html
From now on, days start getting longer again. :) We even had snow for a day again, but it melted. It doesn't look very Christmassy outside. :( But, at least, I finally got the outdoors lights up.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/91466.html

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

Last Tuesday I ate my brussel sprouts (1 points). In July I ruled Iran as a cruel and heartless dictator (-700 points). In August I helped across the street (6 points). In March I committed genocide... Sorry about that, (-5000 points). In May I didn't flush (-1 points).

Overall, I've been naughty (-5694 points). For Christmas I deserve a lump of coal!

Sincerely,
rowaninbloom

Write your letter to Santa! Enter your LJ username:
Actually, the very first one I got was much funnier, but I screwed up with the copy-pasting...
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/91353.html
And, even the snow is gone. :( But, at least I've got up some Christmas lights - I'm hopelessly late with them this year. And, there was some blue sky visible.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/91133.html
We got some snow again. It's quite wet, though, so it probably won't last long.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/90650.html

Winter, I mean. There's a little something white on the ground, and during the last few days, we've got frost, but no proper snow at the moment. And, you must already be tired of these dark pictures. Well, at least I am. But, it's nice to put a light in the lanterns in the evening. And, squirrels are always fun to watch. :D
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/90609.html

Hey, this is a fun one. :)
Your rainbow is strongly shaded violet and red.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

What is says about you: You are a creative person. You appreciate energetic people. You are patient and will keep trying to understand something until you've mastered it. You get bored easily and want friends who will keep up with you.

Find the colors of your rainbow at spacefem.com.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/90232.html
The end of this week was warm again, and by today, most of the snow was gone. Otherwise, nothing new.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/89929.html
This is what the world looked like yesterday. And, this is what it looked like today.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/89737.html
The snowstorm that was forecast for today has started.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/89576.html
Not much new in the pictures this week - people just have started putting up Christmas lights. And, we got some snow toward the end of the week - not much, but anyway.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/89317.html
There was a strange light in the sky today. Too bad it disappeared before I got home. ;)
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/88927.html

Snatched from Frelga:

Your result for Howard Gardner's Eight Types of Intelligence Test...

Naturalistic

27% Logical, 55% Spatial, 8% Linguistic, 51% Intrapersonal, 8% Interpersonal, 18% Musical, 18% Bodily-Kinesthetic and 61% Naturalistic!

"This area has to do with nature, nurturing and relating information to one's natural surroundings. Those with it are said to have greater sensitivity to nature and their place within it, the ability to nurture and grow things, and greater ease in caring for, taming and interacting with animals. They may also be able to discern changes in weather or similar fluctuations in their natural surroundings. They are also good at recognizing and classifying different species.

'Naturalists' learn best when the subject involves collecting and analyzing, or is closely related to something prominent in nature; they also don't enjoy learning unfamiliar or seemingly useless subjects with little or no connections to nature. It is advised that naturalistic learners would learn more through being outside or in a kinesthetic way.

Careers which suit those with this intelligence include scientists, naturalists, conservationists, gardeners and farmers." (Wikipedia)

Take Howard Gardner's Eight Types of Intelligence Test at HelloQuizzy
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/88730.html

The only thing one can do with these evening pictures is to try and find different angles. But, this weekend, we got to our favourite place for pampering ourselves again. We left on Friday; it was already getting dark, but there was still enough light for a picture from the road: This time, the view from our window was a bit dull - the outside of the waterslides, and the University Hospital farther away: Of course, we checked those waterslides from the inside, too. ;) And, when we got home, I finally got a proper photo of the lanterns on the back porch.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/88452.html

Winter flowers on the window: The front yard: Another magpie (there are plenty of them around): What isn't so nice at this time of the year is that, it's dark when I leave in the morning, and dark when I get home. Hope we'll get snow this winter, though not quite yet.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/88135.html

These pics reflect my current mood very closely. Sometimes, I try to bring some light into the darkness, but it feels so futile. :( I'm not suffering from a seasonal depression, I'm just so fucking frustrated.
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/88054.html
There's still something for the birds to eat in the trees, although the leaves have fallen. Last night, we had the first frost. But the day was beautiful, and we made a long walk...
http://rowaninbloom.livejournal.com/87806.html
